japanese:
やはり少し強引すぎだったでしょうか。
みんなも巻き込んでしまって。
でもあの場をなんとかするにはああするしか……。
translation:
Was I a little too pushy, maybe?
Getting everyone involved like that. However, the only
way we were able to do anything was to do that...

japanese:
なあ一花、五月はどうしちまったんだ？
さっきから様子が変なんだが。
translation:
Hey Ichika, what's up with Itsuki?
She's been acting strange lately.

japanese:
おやおや？
フータロー君は五月ちゃんが気になるの？
translation:
Oh?
Are you worried about Itsuki-chan, Futaro-kun?

japanese: ああ、気になるな。
translation: Yeah, very worried.

japanese:
おお……。
君がはっきりそう言うなんて。
translation:
Ohh...
You're being so blunt, you MUST be worried.

japanese:
変な意味に取るな。
今日の目的は、全員の気分転換なんだぞ？
あのまま放っておくわけにもいかんだろ。
translation:
Don't take things the wrong way.
Today's purpose is to improve everyone's mood, right?
I can't just ignore her.

japanese:
じゃあ、ここはフータロー君に代わって
私が一肌脱いであげよう。
translation: Then I'll take care of her for you, Futaro-kun.

japanese:
すまんが頼んだ。
五月が相手だと、こういうときに
俺が口を出すとロクなことにならない。
translation:
Thanks, would you?
With Itsuki, at a time like this,
me opening my mouth would only cause trouble.

japanese: だねー、学んだね君も。
translation: That's right. You've learned quite a bit!

japanese:
う～ん！
久しぶりに思いっきり運動したせいか、
気分もスッキリした～！
translation:
Whoo! It's been a while
since I've exercised like this.
Feels so refreshing!

japanese:
五月ちゃん、
ビーチバレー提案してくれて、ありがとね。
おかげでいいストレス解消になったよ。
translation:
Itsuki-chan,
thanks for suggesting we play beach volleyball.
It was a great way to relieve stress.

japanese:
え？　本当ですか？
それならよかったのですが。
translation:
Huh? Really?
If you feel that way, I'm happy I suppose.

japanese:
本当だって。
他のみんなもいい笑顔だったし、楽しんでたと思うよ。
translation:
Really.
Look how happy everyone is.
They're obviously having a great time.

japanese: ……はい。
translation: ...That's good.

japanese:
（さすがフォローがうまいな。
　俺には真似できん）
translation:
(Ichika is so good at working people.
 I could never do that.)

japanese:
そうだ、これ見てよ。
さっき拾った貝殻だけど、ちょっと可愛いでしょ？
イヤリングとかに加工できたら写真映えしそう。
translation:
Oh yeah, look at this. It's a shell I picked up earlier.
It's kind of cute, isn't it? If I could make it
into earrings or something, it'd look so good in photos!

japanese: わあ、素敵な貝殻です……！
translation: Wow, what a beautiful shell...!

japanese:
きっと探せばまだまだあるよ。
ほら、フータロー君も一緒に探そう？
こういうの見つけたら教えてよね。
translation:
I'm sure we can find more.
Hey, let's search together, okay, Futaro-kun?
Let me know if you find another like this.

japanese:
怪我をしないように気をつけろよ。
貝殻で指を切ったりしたら大変だからな。
translation:
Be careful not to get hurt.
If you cut your finger with a seashell or something,
it could be a big problem.

japanese:
上杉君は心配しすぎですよ。
私たちだって、もう子どもではないのですから。
translation:
You worry too much, Uesugi-kun.
We're not children anymore.

japanese:
でも、この島には病院もないしね。
傷口からバイ菌が入ったりしたら、
大変なことになるかも。
translation:
But this island doesn't have a hospital or anything.
If bacteria got into the wound,
that could be bad.

japanese:
あっ、そうでした！
一花は女優なんですから、特に注意してください！
translation:
Ah, that's right!
You're an actress, Ichika,
so you've gotta be extra careful.

japanese:
一花だけじゃない。
お前も注意するんだよ。
translation:
Not just Ichika.
You need to be careful too.

japanese:
わ、わかってます！
何度も言わないでください。
translation:
I-I understand!
You're just like a broken record.

japanese: じゃあ、時間もあるし３人でのんびり探そっか。
translation:
Okay, we've got time, so the three of us
can take our time and search.

japanese: 綺麗だな。
translation: It's so pretty.

japanese: えっ！？
translation: Wha?!

japanese:
しかし、なんの貝殻なんだ？
ちょっと見せてくれ。
translation:
What kind of shell is it?
Let me see.

japanese: あっ、うん、どうぞ。
translation: Oh, um, here you go.

japanese:
貝殻のことだってわかってるのに
私も単純だなぁ。
translation:
Of COURSE you were talking about the shell.
I'm so naive...

japanese:
ダメだ、わからん。
食える貝だったら覚えてるんだがな。
translation:
Nope, I can't recognize it.
If it were one we could eat, I'd remember it.

japanese:
……ぷっ！　あはは！
なにそれ、ロマンの欠片もないんだから。
translation:
...Pfft! Hahaha!
What is that, so utterly devoid of romance.

japanese:
今はロマンより食材だろ？
お前たち全員を、この島から無事に連れ帰る――
それが今の俺の使命だ。
translation:
We should be focusing on food more than romance.
Getting you guys safely off this island...
That is my mission now.

japanese:
……うん。
頼りにしてるよ、フータロー君。
translation:
...For sure.
We're depending on you, Futaro-kun.

japanese: そうだな、俺も一緒に探すか。
translation: Sure, I'll look too.

japanese: えっ？
translation: Wha?

japanese: なんだよ、その反応。
translation: Why so surprised?

japanese:
いえ、あなたはこういうことには
興味がないかと思ってました。
translation:
Well, I just didn't think
you'd be interested in something like this.

japanese:
俺がほしいわけじゃねぇよ。
らいはにやったら喜びそうだしな。
translation:
It's not like I want a shell, or anything.
Raiha would be happy if I gave one to her.

japanese:
それは名案ですね。
らいはちゃん、きっと喜びますよ。
translation:
That's a good idea.
I'm sure she'd be delighted.

japanese:
そうか、やっぱり女子は
こういう綺麗な物とか可愛い物が嬉しいのか。
translation:
I see, these kinds of pretty things
make girls happy, huh.

japanese:
それはまあ。
でも、らいはちゃんなら
どんなプレゼントでも喜んでくれると思いますよ？
translation:
Well, I guess.
However, Raiha would be happy
with any present you gave her, I think.

japanese:
……前にテスト対策用問題集を自作して贈ったら、
即答で拒否られた。
translation:
...When I put together some problems
to help her prepare for a test,
she rejected them immediately.

japanese:
……ぷっ！　あははは！
もう、あなたって人は、本当に……ふふっ……。
女の子の気持ちを……ふふ、ふふふっ……。
translation:
...Pfft! Ahahaha!
You really, are the kind of person...teehee...
Who can't get girls' feelings...tee, teeheehee...

japanese:
そんな大声で笑うな。
本当にわからないんだから仕方がないだろ。
translation:
Stop your giggling.
I really don't understand. It can't be helped.

japanese:
はあ、ふふ、わかりました。
らいはちゃんが喜びそうな素敵な貝殻、
一緒に探しましょう。
translation:
*sigh* Teehee, I understand.
Let's go find a lovely shell
that Raiha will enjoy.

japanese:
（これもダメか、欠けてるな。
　思っていたよりも欠けたり割れたりしてる
　貝殻が多いんだな）
translation:
(This one's no good, either. It's chipped.
 There are more chipped and broken shells
 than I expected.)

japanese:
（ひとまず、この比較的綺麗な貝殻は
　らいはにやる分として……）
translation:
(For the time being, this relatively pretty shell
 will be for Raiha...)

japanese:
この貝殻、色は素敵なのに大きく欠けてますね。
こちらのは……大きな穴が空いてて台無しです。
translation:
This shell has a nice color, but it's badly chipped.
This one...has a big hole in it. No good.

japanese:
うう……。
もしかして私には、貝殻探しの才能が
ないのでしょうか……。
translation:
Oooh...
Perhaps I don't have the talent
for finding shells...

japanese:
（なんだその才能は。
　ああ、もう、仕方ねぇな）
translation:
(What kind of talent is that?
 Ah, well, I should help her out.)

japanese: おい、いつ――
translation: Hey, Itsu%p-2;――

japanese: 五月ちゃん、なかなかいいのが見つからない？
translation: Itsuki-chan, you can't really find a good one?

japanese:
はい……。
私が拾うと欠けたり割れたりしたものばかりで……。
translation:
No...
All of the ones I've picked up
have either been chipped or broken...

japanese:
そっか。
じゃあ、はい。これあげるよ。
translation:
Is that so?
Well, okay. Here you go.

japanese:
これは……
最初に一花が見せてくれた貝殻じゃないですか。
いいんですか？
translation:
This is...
the shell you showed me first, isn't it.
Can I really have it?

japanese:
いいのいいの。
五月ちゃんが喜んでくれたら
私も嬉しくなるんだ。
translation: Absolutely. If you're happy, I'm happy too.

japanese: だって私、五月ちゃんのお姉ちゃんですから。
translation: Because I'm your big sister, Itsuki-chan.

japanese:
一花……
ありがとうございます、ずっと大切にしますね。
translation:
Ichika...
Thank you so much, I'll treasure it, always.

japanese: （……俺の出るところじゃなかったか）
translation: (...It was good I didn't get involved.)

japanese:
（そういや、あの２人は長女と末っ子か。
　同じ日に生まれた五つ子でも、
　やっぱり姉妹だってことだな）
translation:
(I guess they ARE the youngest and oldest sisters.
 Even though they're all quintuplets
 born the same day, they have a powerful, sisterly bond.)
